column1: Pulmonary nocardiosis is an infection of the lung with the bacteria, Nocardia asteroides.

This includes people who have: - Been taking steroids or other medicines that weaken the immune system for a long time - Cushing disease - An organ transplant - HIV - Lymphoma Other people at risk include those with chronic lung problems related to smoking, emphysema, or other infections such as tuberculosis.
Your doctor or nurse will examine you and listen to your lungs using a stethoscope.
The goal of treatment is to control the infection.
